original: Michaelsson, Erik, ilasarettsiäkare, Västervik, f. 22/9/90 i Hammarby, Stblms k, av las :läk. O^scar M. o. Ma-tikla Masrehez. G. 16 m. Thyra Hedvig Lovisa Backiin. Barn: Bertil f. 18, Ingrid 20. — Mog:ex. i Västervik 08, med. kand. 11 o. med. lic. 17 i Sthlm. Förordn. v. Sabbatsb. sjukh. kir. avd. 15-17, aman. v. Seraf :las. oftalmiatr. klin. 17, andre aman. v. dess kir. klin. 18-19, tf. las:läk. i Finspång 19-20, aman. v. Seraf lias. kir. pöiliklin. 20, förste aman. v. dess kir. klin. 21, under-kir. där 22, tf. överläk. v. Garn :sjukh. i Sthlm kir. avd. fyra mån. 20 o. 22, förste und iiäk. v. Umeå las. 22-24, las :-läk. i Finspång 24-31, v. kir. avd. å länsks. i Västervik sed. 31. Stip. i Fik 14-17, bat:läk. v. Fik 17-23, i res. 23- 24. Stud:resa t. TysM., Österr. o. Ung. 29. RNO, RVO.
translated: Michaelsson, Erik, hospital physician, Västervik, born on September 22, 1890 in Hammarby, Stockholm county, son of physician Oscar M. and Matikla Masrehez. Married on June 16th to Thyra Hedvig Lovisa Backiin. Children: Bertil, born in 1918, Ingrid, born in 1920. Completed medical exams in Västervik in 1908, obtained a Bachelor of Medicine degree in 1911 and a medical license in 1917 in Stockholm. Served as a pro tempore surgeon at Sabbatsberg Hospital's surgical department from 1915 to 1917, as an assistant at Serafimerlasarettet's ophthalmology clinic in 1917, as a second assistant at their surgical clinic from 1918 to 1919, as an acting physician in Finspång from 1919 to 1920, as an assistant at Serafimerlasarettet's surgical outpatient clinic in 1920, as a senior assistant at their surgical clinic in 1921, as an under-surgeon there in 1922, and as an acting senior physician at Garnisonssjukhuset in Stockholm's surgical department for four months in 1920 and 1922. Became a senior resident physician at Umeå hospital from 1922 to 1924, a physician in Finspång from 1924 to 1931, and worked in the surgical department at länsklinik in Västervik since 1931. Received scholarships from Fickföreningen (Fik) from 1914 to 1917, served as a naval physician in Fik from 1917 to 1923, and in reserves from 1923 to 1924. Undertook a study trip to Germany, Austria, and Hungary in 1929. Awarded the Royal Order of the North Star (RNO) and the Royal Order of Vasa (RVO).

achievement.name: Royal Order of the North Star (RNO)
